intro: Cephaelis sandwithiana, commonly known as the Sandwich Island celandine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Cephaelis sandwithiana is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by Native Hawaiians for various health purposes.
